page.title: 09Transport_Leck area
page.content: The A683 from Lancaster to Kirkby Lonsdale is one of the main roads for transport.The A65 from Kendal to Settle is just in the top right corner of our block and the railway follows it but the railway isn't there anymore. They used to transport the milk to Leeds and cattle to the main places where they could get sold,e.g. Kirkby Lonsdale or Bentham.Many thousands of years ago there was a Roman road which was like a motorway to us.There is a Roman Fort near Burrow.The Roman road went from Ribchester to Carlisle. In the country people use cars of their own and don't use buses or a taxi like people in the town.There are now hardly any bus services.Old people who don't have cars find it hard to get into town.
